:ctwokinds-maddiessparkles:
Someone please remind me in the future when I inevitably want to play Apex Legends again that I'm gonna enjoy it for a day, and then get *really* pissed off
isn't that pretty much every multiplayer game...
Apex is rather unique in that they tend to break the game in unexpected ways
And since it's a battle royale title, you need the core gameplay to be flawless, because the genre punishes mistakes / inattentiveness by default
But then to get screwed over by something out of your control?  Unacceptable
This time around, there's a new skin for one of the legends from the new *cough* cash grab *cough* event, that's completely broken her hitboxes :/
Initially it removed the head hitbox, so you couldn't get critical damage.  Supposedly they fixed that, but the model is still prone to no reg hits
...sorry for wall of text ._.
sounds like pretty standard MMO stuff to me, people breking their games with new unbalanced stuff is pretty standard...
bonus points for accidental pay2win
Respawn need to be *really* careful though
This game has a ranked mode, and you can't keep introducing game-breaking stuff like that every update
BR is too unforgiving for that.  Game like Overwatch?  Okay, you might be able to adapt and overcome
But BR you only get one chance a match, and you gotta react on the fly
And if the game decides to delete half your clip and not your opponent's, gg
Guess it's back to scaring myself silly in Amnesia
I think I'm finally near the end :D
any live-service games you like playing, Xexa?
World of Tanks on occassion
which mostly is me trying to figure out which new horribly broken vehicles they added to the game
I stopped playing that game a while back because I was cutting back on gaming
I take it they still occassionally release a completely OP vehicle and go "whoops"?
yep
I remember when I was working for the AMX 50b and they released the T57
Took them way too damn long to realize that it completely obsolesced the french tank.  The Frenchy only had a higher top speed, but was worse in every other regard...
eh, that's still pretty harmless compared to stuff like the 279e
a sowjet heavy with mobility of a medium, no lower glacias and rounded armor everywhere
also known as "throw gold ammo at it and hope it dies"
Guess it's start playing Destiny 2 / FFXIV and/or wait for Shadowlands

on the bright side, it's a reward vehicle for a very hard series of mission, so only the best players in the game actually get it....because those are exactly the kind of people that need overpowered tanks.
Well, don't let me get one then, lol
Man, I used to play a game back in the day called Dust 514. OP weapons were like the norm. If you weren't investing into the OP weapons, you weren't playing the game right.
if the weapons are OP enough it's not like you have another option than to invest in them
It was pretty great though. Everything in game you brought into battle was a one time use item, so if you died, you lost everything and had to buy them again.
that would've not been a game for me
Suit, modules, weapons, equipment were all one time pieces of gear. So every match you entered required budgeting your overall account.
I loved it. If you were good, you could just go in with super basic gear, die 2-3 times, kill a shitload more than you were worth, and make out like a bandit.

It was cross platform with the PC space opera game EVE Online. So in certain circumstances you could link up with a PC player in a ship in orbit over the battlefied and call in an orbital bombardment. Was very fukkin sweet.
This game being PS3 fwiw
but the real question is, how much did it costs for the eve player to bombard XD
Not much other than their time. Bombardment ammo wasn't terribly expensive and the ship class used was only the Destroyer tier. So a few million ISK at most.
https://i.imgur.com/9oO9DES.png I can afford it
